feedback.Physical object: Excluded — The anthem is a symbolic or auditory construct, not a tangible object.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Excluded — The focus is on the national anthem as a formalized cultural abstraction, not any individual recording.
feedback.Fixed/static: Excluded — Anthems may be modified over time or reinterpreted.
feedback.Structural: Excluded — No material or spatial structure.
feedback.Perceptible: Excluded — The abstract anthem exists beyond any specific performance or hearing.
feedback.Material form: Excluded — Not made of matter; it is a conceptual designation.
feedback.Passive: Excluded — It has no reactivity or mechanistic behavior.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Included — National anthems are created deliberately to symbolize and represent nations.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — Requires human performance; the anthem itself is inert.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — No inherent signal or logic processing.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — It does not evolve or update its own state.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Interaction occurs through mediated performance.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — Though related to national protocols, it is not a system component.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — It does not operate on its own.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — A nation functions without it.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Included — It is fundamentally symbolic, often tied to historical narratives.
feedback.Communicative: Included — Conveys identity, values, and emotion.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Not governed by logical structure.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — While songs may have sections, this is not semantically modular.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Included — Associated with ceremonial behaviors like standing or saluting.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — It does not comment on its own structure.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — Although performed in time, its semantic identity is not intrinsically time-based.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Included — Its significance and usage vary with political context, events, or rituals.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Included — Defined within specific cultural or national contexts.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Included — Officially designated by governments or national institutions.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Included — Strongly tied to national and collective identity.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Included — Usage and performance often governed by official protocol.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Included — Passed down via school systems, media, and tradition.
feedback.Visible: Included — Often printed, displayed, or performed in public.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Included — Performance and interpretation shift depending on occasion (e.g., protest vs. sports event).
feedback.Widely known: Included — Recognized and often memorized nationally and internationally.

encoding_notes: This encoding captures the National Anthem as a behavior-guiding, communicative, and symbolic cultural construct, embedded in formal and informal structures of identity and ceremony. The inclusion of both Contextual Abstraction and Context-sensitive is critical for capturing its shifting meanings and uses across diverse settings. It is not a physical or functional object, but rather a dense node of symbolic and social meaning.
